comments.body: Is this a copy/paste oversight? How is the initial focus happening again?
Yeah, for some reason I CAN'T READ.  Removed all of the copies of that, and fixed up the first one (which was the only place that comment belonged).
I have not seen a test use a reason in an expectation. This is awesome. Thank you!
Oh, yes, definitely useful.  _Especially_ when the expect is inside of a loop or another function: it lets you know where in the loop it actually failed.
Well, none of the other tests had that, so I was being consistent.  I added spaces between all the tests.

Nit: Same here
```suggestion
    
    testWidgets('Focus traversal does not break when no focusable is available on a MaterialApp', (WidgetTester tester) async {
```
Also, just curious, is this worth checking for CupertinoApp? WidgetsApp?

iOS doesn't have keyboard support yet, and the Cupertino widgets don't have any focus highlights, and most don't have focus nodes yet, so no, it's probably not worth it for `CupertinoApp`.

Since `MaterialApp` is built on `WidgetsApp`, it's also testing that, but I suppose I could add a separate test in case they ever get separated.
